body_html: So what's happening here is that divide tries to do version-sensitive Python2 or Python 3 style divide. It calls a/b which drops the name, and then gets redirected to Python2 or Python3 version of division. A work-around is to use tf.div or tf.truediv instead of tf.divide.
body_text: So what's happening here is that divide tries to do version-sensitive Python2 or Python 3 style divide. It calls a/b which drops the name, and then gets redirected to Python2 or Python3  version of division. A work-around is to use tf.div or tf.truediv instead of tf.divide.
body: So what's happening here is that `divide` tries to do version-sensitive Python2 or Python 3 style divide. It calls `a/b` which drops the name, and then gets redirected to Python2 or Python3  version of division. A work-around is to use `tf.div` or `tf.truediv` instead of `tf.divide`.
